intro: Clidemia weddellii, commonly known as Hawaiian baby woodrose, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Hawaiian practices. However, it is considered an invasive species in some areas, posing a threat to native ecosystems.
